definition: to impose martial law/to impose emergency measures
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)
restricted area/zone of application of the martial law

sentences.english: Kashmir’s capital, Srinagar, is under military curfew.
sentences.chinese: 克什米尔首府斯利那加正处于军事戒严状态之中。

sentences.english: Germany then declared martial law in these cities.
sentences.chinese: 德国这时就在这些城市宣布戒严令。

sentences.english: The black population is defying curfew and repression.
sentences.chinese: 黑种人不服从戒严和镇压。

sentences.english: The country is under martial law and the airports are closed.
sentences.chinese: 洪都拉斯目前实施了戒严令，机场被关闭。

sentences.english: Selfridge and Quaritch have gone to a state of full emergency martial law.
sentences.chinese: 塞弗里奇和夸里奇已经宣布全面进入紧急戒严状态。

sentences.english: It was abrogated in 1958 when martial law was imposed.
sentences.chinese: 这是废止了1958年的时候，戒严时期被强加的。

sentences.english: The government responded by instituting martial law, causing the football league to be suspended.
sentences.chinese: 政府却以实行戒严法回应，由此导致了联赛的暂停。

sentences.english: President clark has signed a decree today declaring martial law .
sentences.chinese: 克拉克总统今日签署一项法案，颁布戒严令。

definition: to hunt and arrest (fugitives)/to track down and arrest/a manhunt
to warn/to alert/to be on the alert/to stand guard/sentinel
Imperial City, inner part of Beijing, with the Forbidden City at its center
